﻿St. Catharine's Convent of the Sisters of Mercy
instNote: ﻿The House of Protection attached to the Convent generally contains about 112 inmates. These are carefully instructed, and are afterwards provided with suitable situations. The sick and dying poor are daily visited in their own homes and in hospital. The Sisters also visit the City Prison, and the State Prison at Sing Sing, where they instruct the inmates in their moral and religious duties.
